reviews.sentence: The hotel was clean and nice looking. The staff was pleasant. The parking fee is ridiculous and your only option. The hotel is in a good location but poor signage made it hard to find and you ou have views of the parking lot. There was not anything special about this hotel. Although it was nice it seemed old.

Comfortable Reasonable Price. We stayed here as part of a family reuion and get a special price. The room noisey air conditioner. We turned it off. The bed excelentThe bathroom nothing special more than adequate. Immediate hot water. WIFI. Free only in the lobby areaThe halls often small bits of trash here and thereThe View. Surrounded by parking lots and large bank buildings. Nice tresout the window. The Pool small but adequate especially early in the morningThe Hot Tub half full of sudsy water with a brown scum the morning I saw it. Avoided it. The Bar restaurant variable service. One Waiter Marcelo very good eficent unobtrusive. My martini was pretty bad. The food was pretty good. The Front Desk Staff and Concierge Helpful and courteous at all timesThe Valet Parking. Good though not cheap. The surrounding area This is essentially an airport business hotel. Surrounded by huge glass bank buildings with grassy lawns. You could walk to the John Wayne Airport. There is a nature preserve about a mile walk from the hotel with some good birding.

Identity Crisis. This Fairmont is a re branding of a hotel in the business district of Newport Beach near the airport. My room was relatively spacious and looked out over the pool area. I hoped that my Presidents Club membership might provide some amenities but no so much. WiFi included but no water in the room and no coffee maker although there is complimentary coffee adjacent to the hotel restaurant. The hotel fitness center is compact but user friendly as it looks out to the pool. Nice staff expensive parking. The room price was fair. All in all I had say that the hotel does not know whether it wants to be a luxury hotel or a solid business hotel. It needs to do more if it wants to earn the luxury appellation.

Attractive lobby and room room decor. Professional staff. Valet parkIng was well staffed during morning check out rush. Close to shopping and mall restaurants. Attractive well equipped bathroom had wasted space that could have been used to provide a sink and mirror outside of the bathroom. Location is on outskirts of Newport Beach so most vacation activities would require a ten to fifteen minute drive.

Nice Place but Service Weak and Cost of Parking Hi. This hotel is very nice and the location for the price was great. However I had a few complaints that would probably prevent me from staying there again. First you have no choice but to valet the car which adds 30 to the cost of the stay and I had to wait for my car. I would much rather have parked myself. When you add 30 to the price there are better options elsewhere. Second the internet did not work and I had to be transferred to a call center in India to get it to work and then you only get a limited amount of time without having to pay for premium internet. Finally a room service person knocked on my door at 6 am and woke me up but it was the wrong door. Overall the hotel is very nice the location is great but the cost of parking and the service were subpar.

Hot time in Newport Beach. This is a lovely hotel located in a business section so there are not many shops and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel itself has a small shop but it mainly has the essentials. No self parking so that got a bit expensive. Does have a nice pool and outside area but it was too hot outside for us to use it. The hotel was very busy when we checked in so took us a while to get our car parked but once we were went inside we were taken care of quickly and with lovely service.
The toms abd the staff are amazingValet parking only. It would be great if the hotel has valet and own parking optionsOveral is a great hotel.
Great except for lack of self parking. I did not like the parking the valet parking only option was not appreciated.

Parking lot in Newport Beach. This is a Fairmont property but the name is wrong. It should be called Fairmont at Orange County Airport. Seriously there is no beach in site. Yes I know the name of the actual town is Newport Beach but I believe Fairmont misrepresents this property. They require valet parking yet the property is surrounded by parking strucutres and parking lots. Their concierge is so disconnected from the guests they look like they are trying to hide. The elevators are down a skinny hall just past teh rest rooms on the main lobby floor. Just a very poor attempt at meeting Fairmont standards indeed. They had a fire alarm mid morning that went on and on and on then announced it was fals. They had a neighboring building deliver construction materials via a helicpoter for over an hour. No comments to guest about either incident.

Housekeeping Supervisor and Front Desk not good. The tall dark haired man at the front desk needs more training in relating to Hotel Guests ie asking How can I help you and never looking up. He could have been talking to The Donald and never known it. I told him that the housekeeper did not show up the previous day to tend to my room and his answer was Are you checking out. I repeated my complaint followed by the request that the housekeeping be notified that I was out and they could clean the room. He then called housekeeping and told them to make up the room. They did. The following day no one made up the room. My wife called and they brought towels and took out the trash at 1PM while we were there. She called the housekeeping number while the housekeeper was there and the man who answered the phone rudely told her that the do not disturb sign was on the door. She explained that we took the sign down when we left for the day at 2PM. this was a 4 night stay. He told her that if the sign was out when they go through to clean that is it they can not keep on checking. Why can not they call and ask if you would like the room made up like Motel 6 does and the Island Hotel too. No one ever told us to get up and out of the room at a certain time so they could make up the room. Bad service. I felt like I was in a homeless shelter. Leave at their convenience and shut up. The man on the phone in housekeeping acted like he just did not care the lack of service was our fault. Never Again. Vance Wharton The restaurant and the valet parking attendants were great. We were there helping parents to move and unpack. Not a pleasure trip. The housekeeping service and more customer service training at the front desk.

Nice hotel but compulsory parking. 33 day. My sister in law booked the room for us for a nearby family wedding. I did not bother to check on it and assumed that she had done her due diligence. Upon arrival the hotel looked good and the room turned out to be clean and comfortable. But a it was hard to find drove by it once. small signage and the structure is offset from the main roadb. the sound of closing doors banging shut echoed up and down the hallway at late hours not conducive to a good nights sleep. andc compulsory valet parking at 33 per day tipsI feel that managements approach to offset good deals on rates by employing exorbitant parking fees is deceptive. There is no free parking option. You must use valet service and your car is parked in open space. There are two issues that I noted. The first is that there is a long row of parking spots marked 20 minutes only apparently designed to facilitate checking in. Many of those spots had autos parked there and did not move all day. Second there is a large paid lot adjacent to the hotel which gives the impression of being part of the nearby office complex. A large NO HOTEL PARKING sign fronts the entrance. But guess where the attendants park your car. Many are parked in that lot. And people park in the 20 minute row and walk over into the office building. So office people park in hotel free 20 minute space and hotel people pay 33 per day for valet parking and their cars are parked in what would appear to be office parking lot space. No enforcement was observed. The word deceptive continues to come to mind. The parking lot attendants were very cordial and responsive. You want to tip them as they deserve it. So now you are up to around 40 per day to cover parking. Add that number to your good deal and it is no longer such a good deal. Conclusion. I would neither stay there again nor recommend it to others because of managements apparent philosophy of raising funds to offset rate deals via their approach to parking autos. Did I mention the word deceptive. Seems that way to me.
Excellent Choice. Staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to provide for your comfort. I felt parking fee was a bit high.

Exceptional. overall very pleased with service and property. Valet parking rate to high. Felt like you were taking advantage of guest30 for overnight stay highest I have ever paid. Balboa Bay Club is only 200 for overnight parking.

do not go for the pool. Only had double beds in room no Queens They have 1 king option as well. so it was a little tight and the online pics of the pool were deceiving. pool is so small and so crowded for that size hotel. The kids could not even really swim around. Valet parking is all they have and is mandatory at 33 per night and we had to wait a bit longer than we would have liked to get out each time but it was not the end of the world. Food was overpriced at the hotel which I know can be typical so we ate out near the hotel at fashion island. We will not stay here again because of the pool specifically but the hotel itself is nice and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

The Duke has maintained the happy decor. The former Fairmont is now a Mariot Duke and they did a good job of keeping the wonderful ambience and excellent food. Staff is wonderful. No one can stop the planes from flying over from the nearby airport so it is still a location issue if you want quiet by the pool. Only negative 33 dollars a night for parking is too high. Nearby lots that you can not use are only 18 a night. What gives.

Could do better. Front entrance cordoned off so had to find valet parking round the side. Decor in the room 109 looking tired. Bathroom sink cracked. Bedroom carpet very worn and and has marks which need shampooing. 33 for unsecured overnight parking.

Rude people at front desk. Mandatory valet parking costs 33 does not say so when you book it. I asked the rude woman at the front desk and she snapped back saying it says so on our website. I asked to see it she showed me. All it says is valet parking surcharge. So was just rude and not helpful. All I ask is tell me when I book the room about mandatory issues like valet parking at 33 a night. I will never stay there again. nothing Lousy nothing just airport noise tell customers about valet parking before booking.

Pleasant. Hotel bar restaurant food was decent. Location was very close to the airport and UC Irvine. Prepare to pay EXTRA for EVERYTHING. All fees are not displayed on the booking site. They also hold charge 75 day on incidentals up front. What seemed like a great deal I ended up paying way more than expected up front. Note if you drive valet is mandatory as is much of SoCal. Valet parking is 35 a day at the hotel though the incidental charge can can be used to cover valet. If you are flying in local and staying local consider using a ride share ap instead of car rental. Note The pool area was also very dirty.
Great service. Valet parking is only option and outrageous price 33.
